posts.title:
“Just because something is legal, doesn't always mean it's good.”

Stephen Miller has been working to dispel that dangerous 'illegal bad, legal good' cliché for years.

quotedTweet.content: When the adjective “legal” is affixed before a verb it means to have government approval or permission. A state-sanctioned activity. The most uncontroversial but vital policy statement is that a government must not sanction the migration of anyone who rejects the nation’s values.
